info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 8 at 2:01PM CDT until September 10 at 1:40PM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Kansas...
Mulberry Creek Near Salina affecting Saline County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mulberry Creek near Salina.
* WHEN...From late tonight to early Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Widespread agricultural flooding can be expected. Depending on if high flows are present on the Saline River this may backup water on Mulberry Creek which would cause the property on the KOA campground to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 26.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
